repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Nālaṭiyār, followed by an incomplete Cūṭāmaṇinikaṇṭu, chapter 11 (Orucoṟpalaporuṭpeyartokuti).

1 unnumbered f. with satellite material (beginning date: Tuesday, 26th November 1811), verso blank; text with substantial commentary (not corresponding to the commentaries printed in the editions E1+2+3; elements of E3 Tarumar before verse 1) on f. 1r-10v plus 49r-100v, incomplete (1-355), foliation ends on f. 99r, folio 100 unnumbered, text ending abruptly in mid phrase on f. 100v.
17 blank folios; then beginning of Cūṭāmaṇi 11 in three columns, uninked and hardly legible, mostly intact but some folios broken in half (other halves missing) = 63 folios.
Chapter titles but no pratīka. Chapter titles only on rectos, versos left blank if chapter ends early. f. 10-48 = 15 chapters are missing. End with 3 chapters missing.
Description based on the digital images available on Gallica.

extent.measure: {3} + 79 + {63} [3 blank folios; 1 unnumbered folio; f1-f10 and f49-f100, 17 blank folios; 63 unnumebered folios]

collation.desc: 3 folios = guard leaves. Blank recto verso.
1 folio = Nālaṭiyār: Invocation. No foliation. Verso blank.

supportDesc.condition: Mostly good condition, but uneven leaves, some worm damage.

handNote.desc: transitional script with a peculiar intermediate ṟ (double bow but now downwards right stroke) and double kompu
transitional script with a peculiar intermediate ṟ (double bow but now downwards right stroke) and double kompu

additions.desc:
f. 62v, left margin, unblackened:
takarave
tukai
muṟṟum = section follow Etukai beginning with kakara, so takara is not quite the middle of the section

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 72, no. 515.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 118r, no. 515.

Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, June 2022.

body.ab:
ma te grantha with abbreviations
namā
hari Ōm
naṉṟāka
kuru vāḻka
kuruvē tuṇai
vāṉiṭu villiṉ varavaṟiyā vāymaiyāṟ –
kāṉilan tōyāk kaṭavuḷai – yañ –
ceṉṉi yuṟavaṇaṅkic cērtumem muḷḷattu –
muṉṉi yavaimuṭika veṉṟu = Eṉṟatu = vāṉiṭu villiṉ
Ākācattilikum paccaivillaip pōlē – varavaṟiyā vāymaiyāṟ – taṉatu varavai yaṟiyāta meyyoṉṟirukkaiyālē – kāṉilan tōyāk kaṭavuḷai nilattilē kālvaiyāta teyvattai
yāṉilañ ceṉṉiyuṟa vaṇaṅki – nām nilattilē talaivaittu vaṇaṅki – cērttum – niṉaippōm – memmuḷattu – muṉiyavai muṭika veṉṟu – matu maṉattilē – niṉai
ttavai muṭivum poruṭṭeṉṟavāṟu = veḷḷāṉ mālukku vētameṉac cāṉṟōrka – ḷellāruṅ kūṭi yeṭutturaittuc – collāynta - nālaṭi nāṉūṟu naṉ
kiṉitā yeṉmaṉattē – cīlamuṭa ṉiṟkavē ceppu = maṉṉaṉ vaḻutiyarkōṉ – vaikaip pērāttiṉ kaṇṇiṉ ṉirunālār muṉivar – coṉṉa – muḻutillā
nīretirē muṉṉēṟi vantap – paḻutillā nālaṭiyaip pār – vāṇi-namas ttu piṟacōṟpati kāṟtikai mācam ~ 13 tēti maṅkaḷavāram yēkātēci ṟevatinaṭcattiramuṅ kūṭiṉa cupatiṉattil Utittu
ṉā k=ku makara-lak=kaṇattil kaṟtāṉā kumāraṉ cirañcīviṟaṅkayaṉ nālaṭiyār tuvakkiṉatu śrīmatē rāmānujāya namā – paramatiruvē namā = Āḻvār tiruvaṭikaḷē caraṇam

naṉṟāka
nālaṭiyār
celvanilaiyāmai
Aḵtāvatu ~ celvaṅkoṇṭaṟañ ceyya vēṇumātaliṟ celvamorupaṭiyāmai yātaliṟ poruḷ niṟkumeṉṟu ~ karutāma limaikkup pukaḻu maṟumaik kuṟitiyum ~ viraintu cey
taṟ poruṭṭāyiṟ celvanilaiyāmaiyai yuṇarttappaṭṭatu =
Aṟucuvai yuṇṭi yamarnatillā ḷuṭṭa
maṟucikai nīkkiyuṇ ṭārum ~ vaṟiñarāyc
ceṉṟirappa rōriṭattuk kūḻeṉiṟ celva
moṉ
ṟuṇṭāka vaikkappāṟ ṟaṉṟu = Eṉṟatu =
kōṭēt takalalkuṟ peṇṭīrtam peṇṇīrmai
cēṭiyar pōlac ceytē
ṟṟātār kūṭip
putupperukkam pōlattam peṇṇīrmai kāṭṭi
matittiṟappār maṟṟai yavar = st. 354 Eṉṟatu = kōṭēttakalalkuṟ peṇṭīrtam peṇṇīrmai cēṭiyar pōlac ceytē
ṟṟātār ~ pakkamuyarn takaṉṟa valkulaiyuṭaiya makaḷīrtam peṇmaiyiṉa taḻakai yevaṟcilatiyaraip pōla puṉaital ceykaiyait teḷiyār kūṭip ~ putupperukkam pōlat tam pe
ṇṇīrmai kāṭṭi matiṟṟiṟappār maṟṟaivar ~ palaviṭattu nīruṅ kūṭiya poḻutu perukumāṟu pōlat tam peṇmaiyiṉa taḻakaip pūmālaimutaliyavaṟṟāṉavai ~ mikavumoppitti
ṉaip palaṟakumaṟivittippaṭi tammai matittukkoṇṭu viruvar maṟṟanta ~ voḻukkamillātavareṉṟavāṟu Itu kayamaiyāṉa teppaṭiyeṉṉil ~ kaṟpuṭaiya makaḷī rillaṟattiṉaivaḻuvāma
lun ~ tammuṭaiya kaṇavaṉmaṉatu kēvalatta voḻukutalu mulakattār piṉṉaikkoṇṭāṭavirukku miyalpumē taṉakkākavumallatu pūṇappūcamuṭikka vuṭukkaveṉkiṉṟa vivaiyi
ṟṟila viruppamvaiyāmal ~ taṉakkēval ceykiṉṟavarkaḷuṭaṉ vēṟṟumaiyaṟavaḻukkaṭaintiruppa rettaṉai celvamuṇṭākilu mantakkuṇamillāta makaḷīrc celvamilarāyiṉun ~ tammai
yaḻaku ceytukoṇṭu ~ tammai yaḻakuṭaiyareṉṟu ~ yitaṉaip piṟarkkaṟivittun ~ tammuṭaiya kaṇavaṉmaṉatukku vārāmaloḻuku makaḷīraippōlē kayavaṉun tamakkoṉṟu millaiyā
yiṉum peṟuvaḷavilē ~ taṉṉai yaḻaku ceyyum periyōraiyavamatippaṇṇiyun ~ taṉakkorutuṉpam varāta kālattup paṟaiyariṟkaṭaiyāṉa taṉmaiyuṅ kayavaṉkuṇame
ṉṟavāṟu 4
taḷirmēlē niṟpiṉun ~ taṭṭāmaṟ cellā -
tuḷinīrar mātar kayavā raḷinīrāṟ -
keṉṉāṉuñ ceyyā ~ reṉaittāṉuñ ceypavē -
yiṉṉāṅku ceyvāṟ pe
ṟiṉ st. 354 Eṉṟatu taḷirmēlē niṟpiṉun ~ tappāmaṟ cellā ~ tuḷinīrar mātar kayavar ~ taḷirmēlē niṉṟatāṉun tāṉukavuḷiyāṉatu taṟikkamāṭṭātu koṭṭāppuḷikoṇṭu tā
kkiṉālallatu atupōlak kayavarum aḷinīrāṟkeṉṉāṉuñ ceyyā reṉaittāṉuñ ceppaveyiṉṉāṅku ceyvār peṟiṉ tammai yaḷikkattakka nīrmaiyuṭaiyavaṟ kavarevattakka toḻili
yātoṉṟuñ ceyyārellāt toḻilkaḷaiyuñ ceyvaruriyarukkeṉṉi tammaiyaṭita?kkuttiyutaittatuc ceyvikkattakkavaraip peṟileṉṟavāṟu = 5 = malainila muḷḷuṅ kuṟa the text stops short here

Ohari Ōm
Āvatu
Orucoṟpala
peyartokuti
pakavaṉē yīcaṉ māyōṉ paṅkayaṉ ciṉaṉe puttaṉ
pakalēnā ḷorumu kuṟatam pakalva ṉaṭuvē tēcu
makaramē cuṟāppūn tātām vacikūrmai vaciyam vāḷē
yakamaṉa maṉaiyē pāva makilaya muḷḷu mēmē 1
illegible correction below
word split
pakavaṉ Īcaṉ māyōṉ paṅkayaṉ ciṉaṉ puttaṉ
pakal nāḷ Orumu kuṟatam pakalvaṉ naṭu tēcu
makaram cuṟā pūntātu
vaci kūrmai vaciyam vāḷ
Akam maṉam maṉai pāvam akal Iṭam ~ Uḷ
third column almost illegible; probably commentary pakavaṉ Etu
tātiyē paraṇi nāḷu maṭimaiyu miruppeyar cāṟṟum
pōtutāṉ kālam pūvām pōrvaitōl kavaca mikkōṉ
cātamē tiṭampa tappō_ takamaipē riyalpu pīṭām
vītalē koṭuttal kāvām viyappati cayamē kōpam = 3=
